sentences.en: Epoxidation and oxidation gave the racemic C 18 - juvenile hormone.
sentences.cn: 通过环氧化和氧化就得到外消旋的含十八个碳的昆虫返动激素.

sentences.en: Florigen, or the flowering hormone, has been sought by many researchers.
sentences.cn: 许多研究者都在寻找成花素或开花激素.

sentences.en: Fortunately, physicians have pills to correct hormone imbalance.
sentences.cn: 幸好, 医生备有可纠正激素失衡的药丸.

sentences.en: Hormone implants are used as growth boosters.
sentences.cn: 激素植入物被用作生长辅助剂.

sentences.en: Hormone replacement therapy is very important and should be instituted early.
sentences.cn: 激素替代治疗非常重要，应该及早开始。

sentences.en: Moreover, the juvenile hormone of insects is closely related to farnesol.
sentences.cn: 此外, 昆虫的“返幼”激素和法尼醇密切相关.

sentences.en: Oestrogen is a female sex hormone.
sentences.cn: 雌激素是一种雌性荷尔蒙。

sentences.en: Oversecretion of the male hormone androgen can also result in thinning hair.
sentences.cn: 雄性激素分泌过多也会导致头发稀疏。

sentences.en: She has been on hormone replacement therapy for four years and looks fantastic.
sentences.cn: 她接受激素替代治疗已经4年了，看起来容光焕发。

sentences.en: The hormone is responsible for the development of sexual drive.
sentences.cn: 这一激素对性冲动有着重要作用.

sentences.en: The hormone that stimulates gall bladder contraction was called cholecystokinin.
sentences.cn: 刺激胆囊收缩的激素被称为胆囊收缩素.

sentences.en: The main function of this hormone is to control growth.
sentences.cn: 这种激素的主要功能是控制生长.

sentences.en: This hormone interacts closely with other hormones in the body.
sentences.cn: 这种荷尔蒙与体內其他荷尔蒙紧密地相互作用.

sentences.en: Vitamin C has many roles to play in weight control. Firstly, it is needed for hormone production.
sentences.cn: 维生素C在控制体重方面扮演着多重角色。首先，荷尔蒙的生成有赖于它。

sentences.en: Zemel says that when calcium levels are low, the body releases a hormone that helps squeeze the most out of every available milligram of the mineral.
sentences.cn: 泽莫尔博士说,当人体中的钙含量偏低时, 身体里就会产生一种荷尔蒙,它能帮助肌体最大限度地吸收所摄入的钙.

phrases.tran_cn: 抗利尿激素；后叶加压素（一种由脑垂体后叶分泌的多肽激素，能增强血压，导致尿量减少）
促滤泡激素，促卵泡激素
n. [生化]生长激素；[生化]植物生长素
促黄体激素，黄体化激素
n. [化]雄性激素；男性荷尔蒙
应激激素；压力荷尔蒙；压力激素

trans.tran_en: a chemical substance produced by your body that influences its growth, development, and condition
